result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence J. Bradley

defendant.name: Bradley, Lawrence J.
defendant.address: 161 W Main St., Apt 301, Whitewater, WI 53190

records.addlTxt: Signature bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant Lawrence J. Bradley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Lawrence J. Bradley.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:00 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on DE motion to modify bond as to both files - 22CF273 & 22CM264. Court addresses the State as to their position. State is not objecting. Court amends bond to signature as requested. Further record by Atty. Maynard as to status of case and requests another status in about 60 days. Court grants request.

BOND TO COVER 22CF273 & 22CM264

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:01 PM Defendant Lawrence J. Bradley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Lawrence J. Bradley.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness Detective Jacob Hintz.
Jacob Hintz duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA TenHaken.
Witness has identified the defendant on video in court. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
2:04PM - Cross examination by Attorney Maynard.
Evidence is closed.
2:07PM - Argument by ADA TenHaken.
2:08 Defense forgoes argument at this time.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Maynard acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy reserved.


Adj. 2:01PM
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence J. Bradley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Lawrence J. Bradley.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:00 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on adjourned initial appearances as to both files - 22CF273 & 22CM264. Record by Atty. Maynard as to his review of charges and penalties with the defendant on both cases. Not guilty plea entered on the CM file reserving all rights. Atty. requests preliminary hearing on the felony and waives time limits. CM to track with the felony. Court in recess.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney James Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lawrence J. Bradley in court, in custody by video. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appears specially.  SPD working on getting attorney appointment. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lawrence J. Bradley in court, in custody. Attorney Jason Daane appeared specially. Bond remains. SPD has not yet appointed, defendant on PO hold. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lawrence J. Bradley in court, in custody by video. SPD needs time to appoint. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lawrence J. Bradley in court, in custody by video. Defendant referred to SPD. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

*SEE NEW BOND SET 9/29/2022*
BOND TO COVER 22CF273 & 22CM264

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lawrence J. Bradley in court, in custody by video. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Total bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
